Sentencas: Most common types of distributed generation systems utilize power electronic interfaces and, in particular, three-phase voltage source converters (VSCs) which are mainly used to regulate active and reactive power delivered to the grid.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs

Sentencas: The main drawbacks of VSCs originate from their nonlinearities, control strategies, and lack of robustness against uncertainties.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs

Sentencas: In this paper, two time-scale separation redesign technique is proposed to improve the overall robustness of VSCs and address the issues of uncertainties.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs

Sentencas: The proposed controller is applied to a grid-connected solid oxide fuel cell distributed generation system to recover the trajectories of the nominal system despite the presence of uncertainties.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs

Sentencas: Abrupt changes in the input dc voltage, grid-side voltage, line impedance and PWM malfunctions are just a few uncertainties considered in our evaluations.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs

Sentencas: Simulation results based on detailed model indicate that the redesigned system with lower filter gain (is an element of) achieves more reliable performance in compare to the conventional current control scheme.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs

Sentencas: The results also verified that the redesigned controller is quite successful in improving the startup and tracking responses along with enhancing the overall robustness of the system.
Titulo: Performance Recovery of Voltage Source Converters With Application to Grid-Connected Fuel Cell DGs
